column2: For the most wild, yet most homely narrative which I am about to pen, I neither expect nor solicit belief.

column2: My immediate purpose is to place before the world plainly, succinctly, and without comment, a series of mere household events.
column3: My immediate purpose is to place before the world plainly, succinctly, and without comment, a series of mere household events.

column2: From my infancy I was noted for the docility and humanity of my disposition.

column2: I was especially fond of animals, and was indulged by my parents with a great variety of pets.
column3: I was especially fond of animals, and was indulged by my parents with a great variety of pets.

column3: With these I spent most of my time, and never was so happy as when feeding and caressing them.

column2: This peculiarity of character grew with my growth, and in my manhood I derived from it one of my principal sources of pleasure.
column3: This peculiarity of character grew with my growth, and in my manhood I derived from it one of my principal sources of pleasure.

column3: The moodiness of my usual temper increased to hatred of all things and of all mankind; while from the sudden frequent and ungovernable outbursts of a fury to which I now blindly abandoned myself, my uncomplaining wife, alas! was the most usual and the most patient of sufferers.

column2: One day she accompanied me upon some household errand into the cellar of the old building which our poverty compelled us to inhabit.
column3: One day she accompanied me upon some household errand into the cellar of the old building which our poverty compelled us to inhabit.

column2: The cat followed me down the steep stairs, and nearly throwing me headlong, exasperated me to madness.
column3: The cat followed me down the steep stairs, and nearly throwing me headlong, exasperated me to madness.

column2: Uplifting an ax, and forgetting in my wrath the childish dread which had hitherto stayed my hand, I aimed a blow at the animal, which of course would have proved instantly fatal had it descended as I wished.
column3: Uplifting an ax, and forgetting in my wrath the childish dread which had hitherto stayed my hand, I aimed a blow at the animal, which of course would have proved instantly fatal had it descended as I wished.

column2: But this blow was arrested by the hand of my wife.
column3: But this blow was arrested by the hand of my wife.

column2: Goaded by the interference into a rage more than demoniacal, I withdrew my arm from her grasp and buried the ax in her brain.
column3: Goaded by the interference into a rage more than demoniacal, I withdrew my arm from her grasp and buried the ax in her brain.

column2: She fell dead upon the spot without a groan.
column3: She fell dead upon the spot without a groan.

column2: This hideous murder accomplished, I set myself forthwith and with entire deliberation to the task of concealing the body.
column3: This hideous murder accomplished, I set myself forthwith and with entire deliberation to the task of concealing the body.

column2: I knew that I could not remove it from the house, either by day or by night, without the risk of being observed by the neighbours.
column3: I knew that I could not remove it from the house, either by day or by night, without the risk of being observed by the neighbours.

column2: Many projects entered my mind.
column3: Many projects entered my mind.

column2: At one period I thought of cutting the corpse into minute fragments and destroying them by fire.
column3: At one period I thought of cutting the corpse into minute fragments and destroying them by fire.

column2: At another I resolved to dig a grave for it in the floor of the cellar.
column3: At another I resolved to dig a grave for it in the floor of the cellar.

column2: Again, I deliberated about casting it in the well in the yard--about packing it in a box, as if merchandise, with the usual arrangements, and so getting a porter to take it from the house. Finally I hit upon what I considered a far better expedient than either of these.
column3: Again, I deliberated about casting it in the well in the yard-about packing it in a box, as if merchandise, with the usual arrangements, and so getting a porter to take it from the house. Finally I hit upon what I considered a far better expedient than either of these.

column2: I determined to wall it up in the cellar--as the monks of the middle ages are recorded to have walled up their victims.
column3: I determined to wall it up in the cellar-as the monks of the middle ages are recorded to have walled up their victims.

column2: For a purpose such as this the cellar was well adapted.
column3: For a purpose such as this the cellar was well adapted.

column2: Its walls were loosely constructed and had lately been plastered throughout with a rough plaster, which the dampness of the atmosphere had prevented from hardening.
column3: Its walls were loosely constructed and had lately been plastered throughout with a rough plaster, which the dampness of the atmosphere had prevented from hardening.

column2: Moreover, in one of the walls was a projection caused by a false chimney or fireplace, that had been filled up and made to resemble the rest of the cellar.
column3: Moreover, in one of the walls was a projection caused by a false chimney or fireplace, that had been filled up and made to resemble the rest of the cellar.

column2: I made no doubt that I could readily displace the bricks at this point, insert the corpse, and wall the whole up as before, so that no eye could detect anything suspicious.
column3: I made no doubt that I could readily displace the bricks at this point, insert the corpse, and wall the whole up as before, so that no eye could detect anything suspicious.

column2: And in this calculation I was not deceived.
column3: And in this calculation I was not deceived.

column2: By means of a crowbar I easily dislodged the bricks, and having carefully deposited the body against the inner wall, I propped it in that position, while with little trouble I relaid the whole structure as it originally stood.
column3: By means of a crowbar I easily dislodged the bricks, and having carefully deposited the body against the inner wall, I propped it in that position, while with little trouble I relaid the whole structure as it originally stood.

column2: Having procured mortar, sand, and hair with every possible precaution, I prepared a plaster which could not be distinguished from the old, and with this I very carefully went over the new brick-work.
column3: Having procured mortar, sand, and hair with every possible precaution, I prepared a plaster which could not be distinguished from the old, and with this I very carefully went over the new brick work.

column2: When I had finished I felt satisfied that all was all right.
column3: When I had finished I felt satisfied that all was all right.

column2: The wall did not present the slightest appearance of having been disturbed.
column3: The wall did not present the slightest appearance of having been disturbed.

column2: The rubbish on the floor was picked up with the minutest care.
column3: The rubbish on the floor was picked up with the minutest care.

column2: I looked around triumphantly, and said to myself--"Here at last, then, my labour has not been in vain."
column3: I looked around triumphantly, and said to myself-"Here at last, then, my labour has not been in vain."

column2: My next step was to look for the beast which had been the cause of so much wretchedness, for I had at length firmly resolved to put it to death.
column3: My next step was to look for the beast which had been the cause of so much wretchedness, for I had at length firmly resolved to put it to death.

column2: Had I been able to meet with it at the moment there could have been no doubt of its fate, but it appeared that the crafty animal had been alarmed at the violence of my previous anger, and forbore to present itself in my present mood.
column3: Had I been able to meet with it at the moment there could have been no doubt of its fate, but it appeared that the crafty animal had been alarmed at the violence of my previous anger, and forbore to present itself in my present mood.

column2: It is impossible to describe or to imagine the deep, the blissful sense of relief which the absence of the detested creature occasioned in my bosom.
column3: It is impossible to describe or to imagine the deep, the blissful sense of relief which the absence of the detested creature occasioned in my bosom.

column2: It did not make its appearance during the night--and thus for one night at least since its introduction into the house I soundly and tranquilly slept, aye, _slept_ even with the burden of murder upon my soul!
column3: It did not make its appearance during the night-and thus for one night at least since its introduction into the house I soundly and tranquilly slept, aye, underscore slept underscore even with the burden of murder upon my soul!

column2: The second and the third day passed, and still my tormentor came not. Once again I breathed as a freeman.
column3: The second and the third day passed, and still my tormentor came not. Once again I breathed as a freeman.

column2: The monster, in terror, had fled the premises forever!
column3: The monster, in terror, had fled the premises forever!

column2: I should behold it no more!
column3: I should behold it no more!

column2: My happiness was supreme! The guilt of my dark deed disturbed me but little.
column3: My happiness was supreme! The guilt of my dark deed disturbed me but little.

column2: Some few inquiries had been made, but these had been readily answered.
column3: Some few inquiries had been made, but these had been readily answered.

column2: Even a search had been instituted--but of course nothing was to be discovered.
column3: Even a search had been instituted-but of course nothing was to be discovered.

column2: I looked upon my future felicity as secured.
column3: I looked upon my future felicity as secured.

column2: Upon the fourth day of the assassination, a party of the police came very unexpectedly into the house, and proceeded again to make rigorous investigation of the premises.
column3: Upon the fourth day of the assassination, a party of the police came very unexpectedly into the house, and proceeded again to make rigorous investigation of the premises.

column2: Secure, however, in the inscrutability of my place of concealment, I felt no embarrassment whatever.
column3: Secure, however, in the inscrutability of my place of concealment, I felt no embarrassment whatever.

column2: The officers bade me accompany them in their search.
column3: The officers bade me accompany them in their search.

column2: They left no nook or corner unexplored.
column3: They left no nook or corner unexplored.

column2: At length, for the third or fourth time they descended into the cellar.
column3: At length, for the third or fourth time they descended into the cellar.

column2: I quivered not in a muscle.
column3: I quivered not in a muscle.

column2: My heart beat calmly as that of one who slumbers in innocence.
column3: My heart beat calmly as that of one who slumbers in innocence.

column2: I walked the cellar from end to end.
column3: I walked the cellar from end to end.

column2: I folded my arms upon my bosom, and roamed easily to and fro.
column3: I folded my arms upon my bosom, and roamed easily to and fro.

column2: The police were thoroughly satisfied, and prepared to depart.
column3: The police were thoroughly satisfied, and prepared to depart.

column2: The glee at my heart was too strong to be restrained.
column3: The glee at my heart was too strong to be restrained.

column2: I burned to say if but one word by way of triumph, and to render doubly sure their assurance of my guiltlessness.
column3: I burned to say if but one word by way of triumph, and to render doubly sure their assurance of my guiltlessness.

column2: Gentlemen, I said at last, as the party ascended the steps, "I delight to have allayed your suspicions.
column3: Gentlemen, I said at last, as the party ascended the steps, "I delight to have allayed your suspicions.

column2: I wish you all health, and a little more courtesy.
column3: I wish you all health, and a little more courtesy.

column2: By the by, gentlemen, this--this is a very well-constructed house," [In the rabid desire to say something easily, I scarcely knew what I uttered at all,] "I may say an _excellently_ well-constructed house.
column3: By the by, gentlemen, this-this is a very well constructed house," [In the rabid desire to say something easily, I scarcely knew what I uttered at all,] "I may say an underscore excellently underscore well constructed house.

column2: These walls--are you going, gentlemen?--these walls are solidly put together;" and here, through the mere frenzy of bravado, I rapped heavily with a cane which I held in my hand upon that very portion of the brick-work behind which stood the corpse of the wife of my bosom.
column3: These walls-are you going, gentlemen?--these walls are solidly put together;" and here, through the mere frenzy of bravado, I rapped heavily with a cane which I held in my hand upon that very portion of the brick work behind which stood the corpse of the wife of my bosom.

column2: But may God shield and deliver me from the fangs of the arch-fiend!
column3: But may God shield and deliver me from the fangs of the arch fiend!

column2: No sooner had the reverberation of my blows sunk into silence than I was answered by a voice from within the tomb!--by a cry, at first muffled and broken, like the sobbing of a child, and then quickly swelling into one long, loud, and continuous scream, utterly anomalous and inhuman--a howl--a wailing shriek, half of horror and half of triumph, such as might have arisen only out of hell, conjointly from the throats of the damned in their agony and of the demons that exult in the damnation.
column3: No sooner had the reverberation of my blows sunk into silence than I was answered by a voice from within the tomb!--by a cry, at first muffled and broken, like the sobbing of a child, and then quickly swelling into one long, loud, and continuous scream, utterly anomalous and inhuman-a howl-a wailing shriek, half of horror and half of triumph, such as might have arisen only out of hell, conjointly from the throats of the damned in their agony and of the demons that exult in the damnation.

column2: Of my own thoughts it is folly to speak.
column3: Of my own thoughts it is folly to speak.

column2: Swooning, I staggered to the opposite wall.
column3: Swooning, I staggered to the opposite wall.

column2: For one instant the party upon the stairs remained motionless, through extremity of terror and of awe.
column3: For one instant the party upon the stairs remained motionless, through extremity of terror and of awe.

column2: In the next a dozen stout arms were toiling at the wall.
column3: In the next a dozen stout arms were toiling at the wall.

column2: It fell bodily.
column3: It fell bodily.

column2: The corpse, already greatly decayed and clotted with gore, stood erect before the eyes of the spectators.
column3: The corpse, already greatly decayed and clotted with gore, stood erect before the eyes of the spectators.

column2: Upon its head, with red extended mouth and solitary eye of fire, sat the hideous beast whose craft had seduced me into murder, and whose informing voice had consigned me to the hangman.
column3: Upon its head, with red extended mouth and solitary eye of fire, sat the hideous beast whose craft had seduced me into murder, and whose informing voice had consigned me to the hangman.

column2: I had walled the monster up within the tomb.
column3: I had walled the monster up within the tomb.
